content.1: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth?
content.3: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
content.4: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.
content.5: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
content.6: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
content.7: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
content.9: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
content.10: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
content.11: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength
content.12: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather
content.14: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
content.15: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
content.16: She is hardened against her young ones, as though
content.17: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
content.18: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
content.19: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
content.20: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils
content.21: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in
content.22: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
content.23: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
content.24: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that
content.25: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
content.26: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom,
content.27: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
content.28: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
content.29: From thence she seeketh the prey,
content.30: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain
